avalancheActivity.comment: One small avalanche released in Ingólfsfjall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are likely to form on N to NW-facing slopes with new snow fall on Thursday. A high rate of snow melt is expected on Friday and Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are likely to form on N to NW-facing slopes with new snow fall on Thursday. Considerable accumulation can be expected especially in gullies and depressions. Significant melting is expected in the warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvass SV-vindur og talsverð snjókoma til fjalla á fimmtudag. Hlýtt í veðri og rigning á föstudag og laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Earlier this week, many small avalanches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð, Kirkjubólshlið and and Súgundafjörður following snowfall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs especially on N to NW-facing slopes are likely to form with new snow fall and strong winds in the coming days. Wet avalanches can call in melting on Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are likely to form especially on N to NW-facing slopes due to new snow fall and strong winds in the coming days. Considerable accumulation can be expected especially in gullies and depressions. Significant melting is expected in the warm temperatures on Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Storms mun leiða til hvöss SE-átt, hlýrra og nokkurrar snjókomu. Hlýnandi hiti á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: One rather small avalanche fell in Siglufjarðarskarð by Siglufjörður on Monday 20.01. The avalanche did not reach the ski track.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs will most likely form in the next few days. Rising temperatures on Saturday with increased risk of wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs will most likely form in the next few days, especially on W-NE aspects. Rising temperatures on Saturday with increased risk of wet avalanches. Snow pit from Siglufjörður 21.01. showed stiff wind slab ontop of older stiffer firn,

travelAdvisory.comment: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvassar SV-SA-lægar áttir næstu daga og dálítil snjókoma á fimmtudagskvöld. Hlýnar talsvert á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches released in the new snow at the beginning of the week. Many avalances released during heavy precipitation at the beginning of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area after snowfall in recent days. Wind slabs could be present on most aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are widely in the mountains and could be on most aspects. Considerable snow is in gullies. Thaw at the end of the week with rain and increased risk of wet avalanches. A snowpit from Oddsskarð on Jan 26 shows a layered snowpack, which fractured at 20 cm with moderate to hard loading.

travelAdvisory.comment: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles ahead. Wind slabs widely present but chances of wet avalanches over the weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýst í hvassa SA-átt á fimmtudag með snjókomu til fjalla um kvöldið en rigningu á láglendi. Á föstudag er vaxandi S-SA-átt er líður á daginn, hlýnandi veður og úrkoma um kvöldið. Á laugardag er útlit fyrir rigningu, líka til fjalla.
